post.title: Gene
post.contents:
# Gene

Genes are a type of [knowledge] encoded as DNA inside of living organisms that is subject to [evolution].

## Replication

Replication of genetic knowledge is not based on how well it helps the organism survive but how much the it helps the gene in its own copying. A lot of knowledge encoded in genes therefore has incredibly limited reach -- it always has the same solution to a single problem: it explains how to spread the gene through the population at the expense of its rivals[^awoich2].

[^awoich2]: Hackethal, A Window on Intelligence: The Philosophy of People, Software, and Evolution â€“ and Its Implications, Chapter 2.

[evolution]: ./evolution.md
